context_of_use: This use case allows healthcare professionals and patients to view and update personal information for identification and care purposes.
stakeholders_and_interests: Patients want to keep their information up to date.
Doctors want accurate patient information for treatment.
Nurses want to correctly identify patients.
description: This use case enables patients to edit their personal information and allows doctors and nurses to view this information for identification and care.
triggering_event: A user initiates a request to manage patient profiles.
preconditions: The user is logged into the hospital management system.
The user has the necessary permissions to view or edit patient information.
postconditions: Patient personal information is updated successfully.
Doctors and nurses can view the latest patient information.
assumptions: The system has a feature to manage clinical data that is included in this use case.
requirements_met: The system shall allow patients to edit their personal information.
The system shall allow doctors to view patient personal information.
The system shall allow nurses to view patient personal information.
outstanding_issues: Clarification needed on the specific data fields that can be edited by patients.
main_flow: 1. Patient → System: Request to edit personal information.
2. System → Patient: Display current personal information.
3. Patient → System: Submit updated personal information.
5. Doctor → System: Request to view patient personal information.
6. System → Doctor: Display updated patient personal information.
7. Nurse → System: Request to view patient personal information.
8. System → Nurse: Display updated patient personal information.
alternative_flows: AF-1 (from Step 3): If the patient submits invalid information, then System → Patient: Display error message and request correction.
exception_flows: EF-1 (from Step 1): If the user is not logged in, then System → User: Display login prompt.
